law.catch_line: The Office shall administer the Fund as directed by the Executive Committee....

text.section: The Office shall administer the Fund as directed by the Executive Committee.

section.section:
Prior to final action by the Executive Committee, the Advisory Board shall review and make recommendations on:
Program standards;
requests for proposals; and
criteria for awarding grants.
A member of the Advisory Board may not vote on or make any recommendation to the Executive Committee if the member has a financial interest that may be substantially affected by that recommendation.

On or before December 15 of each year, the Executive Committee, in consultation with the Advisory Board, shall review and update the comprehensive plan of after-school and summer opportunity programs as described in paragraph (2) of this subsection.

Each fiscal year, in consultation with the Advisory Board and subject to the availability of money in the Fund, the Executive Committee shall issue a request for proposals under the State procurement law soliciting bids for a grant from the Fund.

Subject to subsection (b)(2) of this section, the Executive Committee may award a grant from the Fund to an applicant only after consultation with the Advisory Board and upon a favorable vote of a majority of the members of the Executive Committee.
In any fiscal year, the total grants awarded to applicants operating within a particular county or Baltimore City may not exceed 15% of the total grants awarded in that fiscal year.
Only nonprofit organizations are eligible to receive a grant.
The Executive Committee must identify and ensure that a responsible nonprofit organization will administer any grant awarded from the Fund.

In selecting a nonprofit organization to administer a grant from the Fund, the Executive Committee shall select the responsive and responsible bidder whose application best incorporates features that will have a positive measurable impact on one or more of the conditions of well-being for Maryland children and youth identified by the Maryland Out of School Time Programs' Quality Standards Framework.
The Executive Committee shall ensure funds are granted to nonprofit organizations in all geographic areas of the State as equitably as possible.

text.section: The Executive Committee may award a planning grant from the Fund to assist nonprofit organizations in a county to prepare an application for a grant for the next fiscal year.
The Executive Committee may award a capacity building grant from the Fund to assist nonprofit organizations to increase staff capacity, training, and sustainability of the Programs.
